author: MaryAnn Molinari
text: 'I was looking forward to coming to this restaurant but I was disappointed with everything I ate I had the Frutta de mar  with pasta. The pasta was tasty but the fish was cut up and barely there. I have had frutta de mar many times with big portions  of shrimp and calamari but you won‚Äôt find it here. My daughter had squid linguine which tasted like sesame chicken.\nAlso we had Brie for an appetizer and that was not good either.. The service was good and the drinks were tasty.'

author: Camille Corum
text: 'Cocktails were eh. Food was bland. Service was slow and terrible. Our empty appetizer plate sat on our table through our entire meal. Our waiter paid us little to no attention.  I waited 15 minutes with an empty glass before he asked if I wanted another drink. Awful.'

author: Nic Bradley
text: 'Solid spot with excellent sparkling wine selections to go with their exceptional seafood.'

author: William Lakebrink
text: 'The cocktails were poorly made with one seemingly missing the syrup entirely. The food was unremarkable with nothing to tie the flavors together in the dish. The spicy shrimp were not spicy at all. The linguine was dominated pepper and lemon flavors which were not even in harmony with each other. The concepts behind the dishes seemed good but the execution was poor.'

author: Theresa Selamie
text: "Fabulous
column5: food was top notch
column6: service was attentive
column7: thank you Evenlyn.  Highly recommend.   When I'm back in the area we will return.  üëç"

author: Steven Van Blarcom
text: 'Has quickly become a go to spot here in hoboken'

author: Hana Sherza
text: 'Went here with a bunch of friends for lunch and ordered a bunch of appetizers. And here is the tea - Oysters were nice and meaty. The brie was the best part of our order
column5: and the shrimp was good too. The octopus was cooked nicely
column6: but I would probably swap it for Tuna.'

author: Fatima Castellanos
text: 'I took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner on 08/18/21. The food was amazing
column5: the ambiance was great
column6: and service was fabulous. We had a great time and ordered 4 drinks
column9: I was overcharged for the experience by a factor of 100% over the final bill and tip (I left ~25% tip on top of the bill amount). I am currently working this out with the restaurant and my card provider. The food and ambiance is great (5 Stars)
column10: but I am giving the handling of customer PCI Data (1 Star). If you decide to give them a try I suggest paying cash.'

author: Joey
text: 'My girlfriend took me out to eat here for my bday 8/15/21. Besides the table next to us obnoxiously talking about puking for outr entire dinner
column5: our dinner was ABSOLUTELY amazing.  Our sever "Brooks" was one of the BEST servers I\'ve seen in years!! He was polite
column6: attentive
column8: and extremely well mannered and professional. He definitely saved the day after the wholesituation with the table sitting next to us. This man deserves a raise or a higher position at this restaurant.  That\'s how good he was. We were really impressed. The food was amazing
column9: flavorful and delicious!! We will be back here soon to dine here again without a doubt. Thanks again brooks we will be asking for you next time we come bro!!'

author: Elijah Durantine
text: "I think disappointed is an understatement. The service was terrible and the food made my girlfriend sick. We went out for my girlfriends birthday and didn't even stay for dessert because we didn't feel like waiting another hour. After we were seated it took at least 10 minutes for our waitress to approach us. We ordered the baked brie and two entrees because we were told that we had to order everything at once. After about 30 minutes
column5: our entrees came out before our baked brie. We tell the food runner that we had an appetizer and after trying to give us our entrees he goes back to the kitchen to check for our brie. About 10 more minutes pass by and who I believe was the manager (didn't introduce himself) approaches us and tells us that we had never ordered the brie and he could give us our entrees now. I asked if we could order the brie and he tells us that they have been out of the brie for a week (our waitress never told us this). He then proceeds to be extremely rude when we try to order another appetizer. He made it seem as if we never ordered the brie and just wasted two entrees. His tone of voice was very accusatory
column6: condescending and rude to the extent that it made my girlfriend cry. After grudgingly taking our order for another appetizer he didn't speak to us again for the rest of the night and seemed like he almost tried to avoid us. After another 30 minutes of waiting we finally get our appetizer. A total of 2 hours in the restaurant for just an appetizer and two entrees was a waste of our time. I will never be coming back."

author: LauSofia SM
text: 'The food is exquisite
column5: the place is cozy and the drinks and the dessert was unique'

author: Maria Sokolova
text: 'My husband and I wanted to have dinner at this restaurant. We came on a Monday evening but they didn‚Äôt have a table at the\nmoment
column5: as the hostess told us. Though there were 2 empty tables. But she promised to sit us in 15 minutes. The hostess wrote down my husband‚Äôs phone number and told us she will call in 15 minutes.\n\n40 minutes later
column6: no call. We passed by
column7: those 2 empty tables still were empty.'

author: Alexander Trofimov
text: 'terrible. so despite constantly having 3 or 4 empty tables outside
column5: they only suggested to put us on the waiting list and guess what - they never called! we were waiting and waiting and waitng and‚Ä¶ nothing. we are still hungry. just avoid this place. the hostess is so careless it‚Äôs just unbelievable.'

author: Joseph Severini
text: "If it wasn't for the food being so delicious
column5: it would get 1 star. The service was awful.  Had to remind her that she didn't always bring the entire order. Go for the food and don't expect anything good from service and you will leave happy. I will go again because the food was so good
column6: hopefully service is better and I can make it a five star."

author: Iulia Ilea
text: 'We had dinner on a Friday. The place was packed and very noisy. We ordered a bottle of wine and it took 15 mins to get it. We had the scallops which were perfect
column5: the octopus (that was chewy and burnt) the spicy shrimps were good. We also ordered oysters which came at the same time as our main. For the main course I had the branzino. It was extremely salty and had soy sauce added as well. My husband got the swordfish which was good but also salty.\nThe one thing that was outstanding was the peach tart which was amazing.'

author: Giulio Dininno
text: 'My favorite new place to eat in Hoboken! Love this place.'

author: Des KF
text: "I made reservations for me and one of my girlfriends for 1pm. When I arrived I was lucky to find parking. Parking on Sundays in Hoboken is terrible. I walked in and told the hostess I was there for reservations and she sat us. I really liked the decor of the restaurant. We were served by Zack and he was nice. When he wasn't around another real nice young lady helped serve us. For appetizers my friend ordered the lobster biscuit. I tasted it and it was tasty but too cheesy. For entr√©es my friend ordered the lobster all'amatriciana and I ordered the salmon burger. My friend really enjoyed her meal. The salmon burger wasn't bad. It was big and filling though. The bill came to about $60. All in all we had a good experience."

author: Michael Perdomo
text: 'Food was very good
column5: but was rushed through dinner which did not seem appropriate for the price range (check thrown on table in under 45 minutes).  Unfortunately ruined the experience for me.  Not sure if this is a new policy as I had been once before and it had been a much better experience.  Prob would not go back.'

author: Alex Brennessel
text: 'Get the scallops. They are the best.'

author: Emily Dello Russo
text: 'Everything from the food
column5: drinks
column6: and atmosphere were great. We also had an awesome server
column7: Ben. Will definitely be back to visit!'

author: Sasha Demenjon
text: "First time coming here. We didn't have reservations but manager was very accommodating and made space for three of us at bar.\nWe ordered several different types of drinks and Brooks
column5: our bartender
column6: did an amazing job on all of them!\nWe ordered the stuffed clams and lobster biscuits as appetizers. I definitely recommend!!"

author: roberto islas
text: 'Love the decor and ambiance super friendly staff  we ordered oysters ü¶™ the small seafood tower tilefish and pasta'

author: Chris V
text: 'Main was excellent
column5: nice place and nice staff. But I was annoyed the the so-called ‚Äúprawns‚Äù I ordered literally were cocktail shrimp and there were like 6. I can‚Äôt believe that with such nice food
column6: they would serve this. I imagined 6 large prawns in a nice sauce of some kind
column7: but literally was served cold tiny shrimp. Not cool.'

author: K Graves
text: "Lovely outdoor seating experience at Sirenetta last weekend. Low-key best friend's birthday dinner was delightfully enhanced by excellent service and witty conversation from the best waiter Zac!All food was delicious and the cocktails even better. The Hoboken Mule was tasty an refreshing
column5: the scallops savory
column6: and the watermelon salad was light and flavorful. I enjoyed the swordfish and the snapper and I'm looking forward to trying the pappardelle when I go back. The peanut butter mousse/chocolate dessert with house made candied peanuts was everything! Thank you Zac
column8: and Brooks for making our visit extra extra special and letting us help you close up the restaurant üòâ Cheers!"

author: William L
text: 'Nice upscale restaurant. Servers are very attentive and the seafood is very fresh. Only downside is the happy hour selection is a little limited.'

author: John Capasso
text: 'We enjoyed our dinner here. I ordered the Cobia and it was phenomenal. We also had oysters
column5: scallops with pork belly and the fluke appetizer. All were delicious. The cocktails were really good and our server had great recommendations based on our tastes.'

author: angelo bellocchio
text:
'We were a group of nine with 1 toddler. They are not child friendly at all. Wouldn‚Äôt even make French fries for my young nephew.
Menu was on line had to use cell phones to access menu . With Covid basically gone I felt this cheesy.
Small portions some pasta plates were very al dente. Smoked crab spaghetti was sent back way too smoky!!!!
Table service was ok until meals were finished
column5: had to ask for dirty plates to be removed. They offered water at the beginning when we were seated not during meal.\nWine list was very overpriced. At this price structure don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll return.'

author: Chris Boudreau
text: 'Always solid food. Staff is friendly
column5: bathrooms sooo clean
column6: and the food! Yes
column7: the food was flawless! Kudos to the Chef and Manager that run this place. A happy staff is a happy experience for the patron. Reflects in every aspect of a restaurant. We hope to return many times!!!!'

author: Caitlin Ursini
text: 'Came here back in March for my birthday and fell in love with this place. There is nothing like it in Hoboken. Came back 2 months later and had a wonderful dinner with my husband but had to leave early because our babysitter had a hard time getting our son to sleep. The manager and bartender made sure to quickly take care of us. Great food
column5: amazing service
column6: and beautiful atmosphere.'

author: Madeline Curley
text: 'Great ambiance and staff. Would come here just for the drinks and desserts any day! Fabulous addition to Hoboken!'

author: Mia S
text: 'First off
column5: I picked this place in hopes of some good seafood dishes . The reviews seemed promising. The place is pretty that‚Äôs the best I can say. The menu is limited. My husband ordered salmon which came with some super bitter arugula & nothing else  . I ordered the crab spaghetti & it tasted like someone dipped it in a salt bin & just threw it on a plate with some bitter shredded Brussels sprouts. Who knows
column6: maybe I‚Äôm spoiled because I‚Äôm Hispanic and we know what flavor is. Never coming back here. Womp womp .'

author: Karla Sutton
text: 'Amazing food and service! The biscuits
column5: .so yummy and delicious cocktails. Our entire party loved every dish.'

author: Robin Zapata
text: "Food was ok. The lobster pasta dish was super salty but still edible which we mentioned. Raw oysters were fine and the octopus was cooked well. They forgot the stone crab dish which we mentioned at the end of the meal and they comped a dessert in it's place which was ok. They also got me a silver tequila instead of the reposado I ordered but I just didn't bother bringing it up. Wine was decent. The decor is really nice inside. I wouldn't come back though. Too many off things and there were only about 5 or 6 other tables in there. The servers were nice but I guess didn't care enough to get the orders correct."

author: Natali Gonzalez
text: "We had been meaning to try this restaurant for a while and I'm very happy we did
column5: the service was very friendly and professional. We tried their oysters and crab legs
column6: but I wasn't too impressed with that. The standout for me was the local pork porterhouse
column8: I absolutely recommend going for this dish. I do want to go back to have  that dish again but give the rest of the dinner menu a try."

author: Suthida Chuenklin
text: "This place definitely doesn't deserve less than 5 stars from me! I have been living in Hoboken for 2 years and I regret for not coming here sooner. I would recommend all the dishes we ordered here
column5: there were so delicious. It was worth every $ we spent here
column6: including the service. I can't wait to come back here to try other items on the menu!"

author: Harry Lee
text: 'Salty and too small portion.'

author: Takun Yamaguchi
text: 'Great atmosphere
column5: kind waiters and hostess. The food was quite good
column6: however it is a bit expensive and the portion of the food is ok. However it was great food and drinks'

author: Gina Bucchiano
text: 'Great food!  the stuffed claims
column5: and the squid ink  pasta were my favorite! Brooks was our fantastic server! They also make the BEST
column6: whiskey sour in all of Hoboken. üç∏‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê'

author: Brandi Brister
text: "My hubs accepted an offer for a great new job so I took him to dinner at Sirenetta to celebrate. The super lovely hostess said we had a little wait before our reserved table was ready so we went to the lounge in the back for a round of cocktails beforehand. The cocktail list is small and creative and we both enjoyed what we ordered.\n\nWhen our table was ready the hostess came to the back lounge and brought us to our table up front. She grabbed a silver tray from the bar and carried our drinks to the table as well. Of course we can carry our own drinks
column5: but it is a nice touch given the price point of the restaurant
column6: which is quite up there for Hoboken.\n\nOur server was Zack and he was truly fab. Great personality
column8: and checked in with us just the right amount. I will be asking for him every time we go in.\n\nWe ordered the Spicy Shrimp & Frittes (amazing)
column11: but way too black pepper-y for my taste). A really wonderful dining experience. We will be back."

author: mayra flores
text:
'(Translated by Google) Very good

(Original)
Muy bueno'

author: Camilo F√©liz Flores
text: 'AMAZING!'

author: Umesh Gajria
text: 'Excellent food
column5: both taste and presentation.  A rare Hoboken restaurant at the NYC trendy standard.  Fairly priced.  Good service
column6: staff was friendly and engaging.  Ambiance and decor were good too.'

author: Eric Hammer
text: 'My first Sirenetta experience was interesting but good. We came in with big expectations due to the high praise from others. We booked a Friday night reservation almost a week in advance
column5: and we were seated pretty much right away.\n\nThe place is gorgeous and clean. We sat at a table close to the bar with clear sight light to the raw bar. And arguably most importantly
column6: the staff was great. The hostess
column9: and the bartender were incredibly kind
column11: and personable.\n\nWe ordered two drinks from the Moscow Mule Bar
column12: both of which were delicious. One was made with Jameson and peach liqueur
column13: the other with bourbon. We love mules
column14: so this was a no brainer for us.\n\nFor starters
column15: we ordered the Grilled Octopus. This was our favorite dish of the night. Absolutely delicious
column17: big flavor. Highly recommend.\n\nOur starters were regrettably less than impressive. Our Mahi Mahi was tasty but undercooked
column18: to the point where it could have
column20: been sent back. The very middle of the fish was noticeably raw
column21: but the rest of the fish was good enough. It was served with a few different forms of eggplant
column22: the thinly fried eggplant being the standout side component.\n\nThe other starter
column24: was the Lobster Rigatoni. The lobster portion was generous
column25: and the lobster itself was awesome. Unfortunately the pasta was a little too al dente. I like my pasta a bit softer
column26: but this bordered on chewy. It was especially disappointing because it was homemade pasta.\n\nOverall it was a good
column28: experience. I would definitely return to Sirenetta again
column29: in fact I look forward to dabbling with the raw bar and other dishes.'

author: daryl ciambella
text: "the grilled octopus and the salmon dinner were delicious.  the smoked crab was good but was rather light on crab.  Lobster all'Amatriciana was good
column5: not great.  definite worth trying"

author: Alexandra Ortiz
text: "I love it
column5: it's not my first time
column6: wine and seafood üòã"

author: Robert Zedeck
text: 'This place is very overrated.  The swordfish milanese was actually just bad fish fry'

author: Joanna Melendez
text: 'My fianc√© and I celebrated our anniversary here and had an amazing experience. The ambiance is that of a restaurant you would find in the LES. The food and drinks were perfect. Our waiter
column5: Alexander
column6: was friendly and attentive and gave us some excellent recommendations. We will definitely be back!'

author: Kristina
text: 'My friends and I decided to check this new place without any expectations. Coz Hoboken is full of average food restaurants but they all are packed anyway. I guess people don‚Äôt care how tasty is the food. This place surprised me. Food options are interesting and tasty. Cocktails also very good. I love it.'

author: P C
text: 'Delicious and fresh seafood. Excellent service. Clean and modern decor. Will definitely be back!'

author: Chris Shimmin
text: 'This place is the go-to-spot for seafood in Hoboken. Oysters
column5: king crab legs
column6: clams
column8: full bar.\n\nAnd they have a happy hour m-f.'

author: Joseph Tierney
text: 'Arguably the best restaurant in Hoboken. Phenomenal.'

author: Kevin Whitaker
text: "[Takeout] Enjoyed the seafood dishes a lot
column5: especially the lobster all'amatriciana
column6: and the food was packed nicely and traveled well. Had a small snafu with the online ordering but they were helpful in getting it fixed."

author: Andres Giraldo
text: 'Sirenetta is by far the best new restaurant in our area
column5: food and service are both amazing.'

author: Erica Campanella
text: 'Great place in Hoboken! Wilson was a fantastic waiter! The oysters are the best in the area'

author: Sam B
text: 'Although this place is fairly new
column5: I would say it does need some adjustments. We ordered 3 dozen oysters
column6: which may have not been thoroughly cleaned because we were all swallowing/chewing on bits of hard pieces with every single one. The apps are SMALL
column7: we ordered 4 different ones and they are definitely not "sharing size" for 4 people. The main courses were good
column8: but definitely on the smaller side as well. The drinks were just average
column9: nothing spectacular for the price. We all left hungry still. Other than that
column10: the ambiance is nice and the place is clean.'

author: Kevin Devaney
text: 'What a great place.  The food was delicious.  Our server have us great recommendations.  The restaurant has a great atmosphere.  We will definitely be back.'

author: Jonathan Greenstein
text: 'Best new restaurant in town. Every bite was delicious especially the halibut and the pumpkin mousse.  One piece of constructive criticism.. The prime rib isnt actually prime rib
column5: which is a cut of roasted rib roast. Their offering is actually a grilled ribeye. Which was totally delicious but it might be good to correct the menu.'

author: Leo
text: 'The food at this place is amazing! Everything was so delicious and fresh! We had fried oysters ü¶™ as well as oysters on the half shell (East Coast.) For the entrees
column5: we had the Mussel Scampi which was absolutely incredible and the Swordfish Milanese!\nWe will definitely be coming back!'

author: Carine A
text: "Our new favorite date-night restaurant. We've been here twice
column5: and we've had excellent service and dining experience both times.\nThe ambiance is great; upscale yet cozy and inviting. The food and cocktails are delicious. The hospitality is outstanding. A special shout-out to Michael at the bar. Thank you for such wonderful service every time we've come in. Also
column6: Carissa our waitress was very sweet and helpful. Thanks ya'll. We'll be back soon üòâ"

author: Paula Christensen
text: 'Experience was great. We sat at the bar
column5: which didn‚Äôt have a lot of people at it and was well distanced. The bartenders were fun and knowledgeable about the food and wines. Drinks were a little sweet
column6: but we asked for our next drink to be toned down and it was perfect. The food was SO GOOD. We had the crudo
column9: lobster pasta and gnocchi with seafood dumplings. For desert the pumpkin. The gnocchi and mushroom coquettes were unlike anything I‚Äôd tried before and very tasty. We enjoyed the other food as well. Go and enjoy this fun new Hoboken restaurant.'

author: Dylan P
text: 'Amazing food and great service. Upscale-casual vibes. Great addition to the neighborhood!'

author: Alessandro Cardito
text: 'It‚Äôs great to finally see a decent restaurant coming to Hoboken- the ambience and the food are what you would expect from a spot in LES or Brooklyn Heights
column5: that‚Äôs great news!\nThe service was ok- we had a reservation and nevertheless had to wait over 30min
column6: which wasn‚Äôt cool...and the menu mentioned we would get offered a selection of starters for participating to the soft launch of the restaurant... but we found out it was only for the friends and family of the owner...I‚Äôm which case I‚Äôm not sure why it was on the menu?\n\nAnyway
column7:
food was great- only exception being the fried oysters...which were very much a typical American seafood item...not a lot of flavor besides the greasiness.

The menu doesn‚Äôt have prices which I found interesting- eventually it came to 85$/pp which I think was right for the quality and amount of food we had.

Overall recommended!'
